Text:
After unraring these files, then dbl-clicking on the img-file I get "Unexpected File Format" in Nero. Would someone kindly tell me how to get beyond this problem?

I'll keep the files on the HDD and seed on...
but I nedd some assistance :-)
burn the img file to a DVD using DVD Decrypter.

Just rename the .img-file to .iso
Nero can read it then.

Thanks Merlin,

I had inadvertently turned on "Hide file extension for known files" in Windows and when turned off it showed the file extension".img". I followed your advice and substituted it with ".iso" and brought the file to Nero and it burned like a breeze...

Thanks for helping me out; I owe you one!

Olav
I can't watch the film on any of my dvd players...it works fine on the computer but when I put it in the dvd player it tries to read it but then stops...why is that? does anyone know?

Oh, kind miss,
Follow the thread above and do the same; rename the file extension .img to .iso and burn it... most likely it will play in your DVD player as it finally did in mine!

Can any1 please tell me what extras were stripped and which one(s) kept?

Thank you very much!
